prompt: Close-up, photorealistic shot of a GIA certified gemologist meticulously examining a diamond ring with a 10x loupe. The ring is set on a black velvet pad under bright, focused LED lighting. The gemologist's hands are visible, wearing nitrile gloves, and the background is blurred, showing a professional jewelry appraisal workspace with various tools and certificates. Focus is sharp on the diamond and the loupe. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6
name: how-to-appraise-jewelry-image-1.png

prompt: Wide shot of a well-lit, modern jewelry appraisal office. In the foreground, an appraiser sits at a desk with a computer displaying jewelry appraisal software. A client sits opposite the appraiser, presenting a vintage necklace. The office is clean and professional, with framed certifications on the wall and soft, diffused natural light coming through a large window. The composition should feel inviting and trustworthy. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6
name: how-to-appraise-jewelry-image-2.png

prompt: Over-the-shoulder shot of an appraiser using a calibrated digital scale to weigh loose gemstones (diamonds, sapphires, emeralds) in a small tray. The scale's display is clearly visible, showing the weight in carats. The background is a close-up of a gemological microscope with various gemstones under examination. The lighting is bright and even, highlighting the precision and accuracy of the appraisal process. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6
name: how-to-appraise-jewelry-image-3.png

prompt: Detailed macro shot of a platinum engagement ring under a gemological microscope. The image should showcase the intricate details of the setting, including the prongs, pav√© diamonds, and any hallmarks. The lighting is carefully controlled to highlight the facets and brilliance of the stones. The background is dark and out of focus, emphasizing the ring's beauty and craftsmanship. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6
name: how-to-appraise-jewelry-image-4.png

prompt: Panoramic view of a jewelry appraisal workshop. Various tools are arranged neatly on a workbench: refractometer, polariscope, dichroscope, millimeter gauge, and a selection of grading books. A partially disassembled watch lies on the bench, suggesting horological expertise. The overall impression is of a highly skilled and knowledgeable professional jeweler. The lighting is warm and inviting, creating a sense of artistry and craftsmanship. --ar 16:9 --style raw --v 6
name: how-to-appraise-jewelry-image-5.png
